meanings.definition: The act of constructing or repairing wooden structures.
meanings.sent1: Carpentering involves building and fixing things with wood.
meanings.sent2: He learned carpentering to help repair the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent3: The carpentering on the treehouse made it the envy of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her carpentering skills were as precise as a surgeon's hands.
meanings.sent5: The sound of carpentering echoed through the workshop, a symphony of craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: The trade or occupation of working with wood to build or repair structures.
meanings.sent1: In the past, carpentering was one of the most sought-after professions.
meanings.sent2: He decided to pursue carpentering as a career after building his own bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The carpentering business was booming, with orders coming in from all over town.
meanings.sent4: She approached her carpentering work with the precision of a master artist.
meanings.sent5: The art of carpentering was passed down through generations in their family.

meanings.definition: The skill or practice of shaping, cutting, and joining wood to create objects or structures.
meanings.sent1: His carpentering improved with each project he completed.
meanings.sent2: The intricate details in her carpentering work showcased her talent.
meanings.sent3: The carpentering class was full of beginners eager to learn the craft.
meanings.sent4: She approached the intricate carpentering task with patience and determination.
meanings.sent5: The carpentering of the wooden ship was a true work of art.
